org.gearvrf.scene_objects

Class GVRCameraSceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject
        • org.gearvrf.scene_objects.GVRCameraSceneObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, GVRDrawFrameListener

    public class GVRCameraSceneObject
extends GVRSceneObject
implements GVRDrawFrameListener
    A scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, float width, float height, Camera camera)
      Create a 2D, rectangular scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
      GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext, GVRMesh mesh, Camera camera)
      Create a scene object (with arbitrarily complex geometry) that shows live video from one of the device's cameras

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onDrawFrame(float drawTime)
      Called each time a frame is drawn.
      void pause()
      Pauses camera preview
      void resume()
      Resumes camera preview

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            GVRMesh mesh,
                            Camera camera)
        Create a scene object (with arbitrarily complex geometry) that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        mesh - an arbitrarily complex GVRMesh object - see GVRContext.loadMesh(org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource) and GVRContext.createQuad(float, float)
        camera - an Android Camera. Note: this constructor calls Camera#setPreviewTexture(SurfaceTexture) so you should be sure to call it before you call Camera#startPreview().

      • GVRCameraSceneObject

        public GVRCameraSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            float width,
                            float height,
                            Camera camera)
        Create a 2D, rectangular scene object that shows live video from one of the device's cameras
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        width - the scene rectangle's width
        height - the rectangle's height
        camera - an Android Camera. Note: this constructor calls Camera#setPreviewTexture(SurfaceTexture) so you should be sure to call it before you call Camera#startPreview().

    • Method Detail

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes camera preview

        Note: pause() and resume() only affect the polling that links the Android Camera to this GVRF scene object: they have no affect on the underlying Camera object.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses camera preview

        Note: pause() and resume() only affect the polling that links the Android Camera to this GVRF scene object: they have no affect on the underlying Camera object.

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float drawTime)
        Description copied from interface: GVRDrawFrameListener
        Called each time a frame is drawn. Callbacks are called (from GVRViewManager.onDrawFrame()) in subscription-order, after any 'one shot' callbacks and before GVRScript.onStep().
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Parameters:
        drawTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()
